intro: Hieracium humiliceps, commonly known as the common hawkweed, is a low-growing perennial plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its rosette of basal leaves and yellow-orange composite flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped with hairy surfaces, and the flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Hieracium humiliceps is known for its ability to spread through rhizomes and is considered a weed in some agricultural settings.
